did.head: Descriptive Summary
did.abstract: Anna Howell Hayward Lisle worked with the United Nations Relief and Rehabilitation Administration and Near East Foundation relief efforts in Greece from 1944-1946. The papers include correspondence, reports, and photographs, relating to social conditions and relief work in Greece at the end of World War II.
did.langmaterial: Languages represented in the collection: English

accessrestrict.head: Access
accessrestrict.p: The collection is open for research

Access to audiovisual materials requires at least two weeks advance notice. Audiovisual materials include sound recordings, video recordings, and motion picture film. Hoover staff will determine whether use copies of the materials requested can be made available. Some materials may not be accessible even with advance notice. Please contact the Hoover Institution Archives Audiovisual Specialist for further information.

userestrict.p: For copyright status, please contact the Hoover Institution Archives

accruals.head: Accruals
accruals.p: Materials may have been added to the collection since this finding aid was prepared. To determine if this has occurred, find the collection in Stanford University's online catalog at http://searchworks.stanford.edu/. Materials have been added to the collection if the number of boxes listed in the online catalog is larger than the number of boxes listed in this finding aid.

chronitem.event: Born, Wayne, Pennsylvania, known to friends and family as "Nancy"
Teacher, Lower School of the Shipley School, Bryn Mawr, Pennsylvania
First expressed interest in working with World War II relief organizations

Began working on a United Nations Relief and Rehabilitation Administration (UNRRA) funded project in rural Greece, and was supported by UNRRA through October 1945 while working for the Congregational Christian Service Committee.
Began working for the Near East Foundation as Director of Child Welfare for the West Coast
Returned to the United States, married Clifton Lisle, and settled in Chester Springs, Pennsylvania for the rest of her life.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content of Collection
scopecontent.p: Anna Howell Hayward Lisle worked with the United Nations Relief and Rehabilitation Administration and Near East Foundation relief efforts in Greece from 1944-1946. The papers include correspondence, reports, and photographs, relating to social conditions and relief work in Greece at the end of World War II.

The documentation describes Lisle's work in Greece, focusing on the villages of Patras, Yannina, Konitsa, and Agrinion (not far from the boarder of Albania) where she was part of an effort to establish youth hostels that hosted local children and children from nearby mountainous regions for three-month periods. The children were bathed, given clothing, shoes, medicine, and inoculations. They were taught in schoolroom settings and nourished with a healthy diet. Lisle also collaborated with many charitable groups, including the General Federation of Women's Clubs, to obtain donations of clothing and other items for the Greek villagers. In addition, she studied the culture and diet of the region, as evidenced in her reports, notes, and correspondence.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: The collection is organized into three series, Biographical Document, Photographs, and Greek Relief Work.

scopecontent.p: Includes a bound document, created circa 2001 with biographical information and photocopies of correspondence from 1934-1957, training documentation, and general personal correspondence.
Bound document with Biographical Information and photocopies of correspondence from 1934-1957

did.unittitle: Relief of the Northern Provinces of Greece calendar,

scopecontent.p: Some cards include photographs of Greece
Black and white prints and negatives of landscapes, villages, people, children, camps, youth hostels, and aid workers in Greece. Some photographs are labeled with the city Konitsa.

did.unittitle: "Nancy" Anna Hayward Lisle with other aid workers,
Near East Foundation photograph album with captions,

scopecontent.p: Includes correspondence, reports, notes, and other documentation describing the social and economic conditions in Greece after World War II and the relief work conducted by organizations such as the United Nations Relief and Rehabilitation Administration (UNRRA) and the Near East Foundation
